data.title: Meet Our Staff
data.meta_description: The VAVA High School Admin team is the backbone for the day-to-day operations of the school and leverage their extensive experience serving both public and private enterprise to keep VAVA running...
data.text:
Su Garcia-Batiz

Principal

Su Garcia-Batiz joined the Virginia Virtual Academy in July 2019 as a Health/PE teacher and Administrative support at the Middle School. In July 2020, she became an Assistant Principal at the Middle School and in August 2021, she was proud to accept the role as the Middle School Principal. In August of 2022, Mrs. Garcia-Batiz accepted a new role as the Principal for all students and staff, grades 6-12. Prior to joining VAVA, she spent 12 years teaching for Prince William County Schools and 3 years as an Instructional Coach for K12. Mrs. Garcia-Batiz earned her Undergraduate Degree in Psychology with a minor in Criminal Justice from George Mason University in 2004. She earned her Masters Degree in Special Education, ED/LD in 2007 from George Mason University and her Masters Degree in Educational Leadership from American College of Education in 2011. Mrs. Garcia-Batiz currently lives in Prince William County with her husband, who is also an educator, two daughters; Natalia (8) and Mila (10) and their pet Boxer, Jab. Her family likes to spend time outdoors; finding new parks to hike at or just playing in the backyard. She loves being a VAVA Bee and is looking forward to continuing to support the Middle and High School.

​Jess Carter

​

Assistant Principal

Jessica Carter joined the Virginia Virtual team in 2018 as a special education teacher, and currently serves the students and staff at VAVA as an assistant administrator at the high school. She has served students in K-12 over her 20 years in education in special education and as an instructional technology resources teacher. Jessica earned a Bachelor of Science in Special Education, K-12 from Radford University. Her graduate work consists of a Master of Arts for instructional technology from George Mason University and a Master of Arts in Educational Leadership from Radford University. Jessica lives in Fredericksburg, VA with her husband and 4 children, two of which are students at VAVA. Her children are busy with many sports and theater and she enjoys spending her time supporting them do what they love. Jessica’s family enjoys supporting the community by fostering dogs that have been rescued and looking for their “furever” home. They have been known to have up to 9 dogs at one time, along with their 4 cats. Supporting the school community at Virginia Virtual Academy brings a lot of joy to Jessica and she loves being part of the VAVA family!

​Chip Deliee

​

Assistant Principal

Chip joined VAVA in 2022 as one of the High School Assistant Principals. He came to VAVA after 32 years working in Fairfax County. During his time in Fairfax, he served students as a Special Education teacher, District assessment specialist, Assistant Principal and Principal. Mr. Deliee received his bachelor’s degree from James Madison University and his Masters in Administration and Educational Leadership from George Mason University. He lives with his wife, Sharon in Warrenton, Virginia. They have 3 children, Brendan (26), Kristopher (24) and Amanda (20) and one dog, Buster. Amanda is currently a Junior at JMU studying to be a teacher. He is excited to be a part of such a wonderful team and looks forward to supporting students and families at VAVA this school year.

Morgan Horne

Assistant Principal

Morgan Horne joined the Virginia Virtual Academy team in August 2020 as a middle school counselor. In 2021, Ms. Horne joined the Data and Assessment team before moving to the high school counseling team in 2023. She now serves high school families and staff members as one of the Assistant Principals. Before VAVA, Ms. Horne served as a middle school and high school counselor in Pittsylvania County for seven years. Ms. Horne earned her undergraduate degree in History with a minor in Dance from the University of Virginia in 2011. She earned her Masters Degree in School Counseling in 2013 and her Education Specialist in Educational Leadership in 2017 from Liberty University. Ms. Horne currently lives in Pittsylvania County with her two daughters; Lillian (5) and Eleanor (2) and their Pit Bulls, Hemi and Bristol. Ms. Horne is also a Certified Personal Trainer so when she’s not working, you will probably find her at the gym coaching clients through a workout. Besides working and working out, Ms. Horne enjoys spending time with her kiddos, being outside (especially in the sunshine!), listening to live music, and reading a good book with a cup of coffee. Ms. Horne is so excited to continue supporting VAVA families and staff this school year!

Christopher Peterson

Science Department

Mr. Peterson lives in Richmond, VA and has lived in almost all the states from VA up to ME. He is a proud husband, and the proud father of one daughter and one dog. He graduated from Hampden-Sydney College in 2001 with a B.S. in Biology, and spent several years after college working in Conservation from Virginia to Wisconsin. This will be Mr. Peterson’s 15th year teaching High School Science in Virginia, and has taught courses in Biology, Honors Bio, Bio II Oceanography, Ecology and, of course, Earth Science!

From a very young age, Mr. Peterson has had a fascination and appreciation for the natural world (especially shorelines) that has only grown with age and experience. A self-proclaimed “lifelong-learner”, Mr. Peterson finds joy and inspiration in teaching and learning with his students, visiting National and State parks, studying Music, Art, Geology, Cosmology and Physics in his spare time.

Mr. Peterson has found what he believes you will find to be a very special team of teachers at VAVA High School and is honored to be the person to take you on a mind-expanding journey this year; from the center of our earth to the stars and beyond…​
